active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the most critical challenges in the EDRM Preservation and Collection stages during a cybersecurity breach investigation (e.g., chain of custody risks, data volume). Propose best practices and evaluate how AI tools like TAR could mitigate them, citing real-world litigation cost impacts (~$5B/year in US eDiscovery).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in E-Discovery and the Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM). Topic hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Legal, Regulatory, and Compliance > Investigations and Digital Forensics > E-Discovery > EDRM. Use the provided learning objectives, active learning activities, 4-layer scaffolding, and flashcard schema EXACTLY to generate high-quality Anki-compatible flashcards. Core Content (Complete EDRM from edrm.net, repariodata.com): - eDiscovery: Process for ESI in legal cases. - ESI: Digital info (emails, docs, etc.). - Nine Stages: 1. Info Governance (data lifecycle mgmt); 2. Identification (locate ESI); 3. Preservation (legal holds); 4. Collection (forensic imaging, chain of custody); 5. Processing (dedup, indexing); 6. Review (cull, privilege log); 7. Analysis (TAR/AI, clustering); 8. Production (TIFF/Native format); 9. Presentation (court use). Iterative; reduces ~$5B US litigation costs. Incorporate pedagogy: Objectives span Bloom's (Remember to Create); active learning links; scaffolding progression (Layer 1 Foundation to 4 Integration). Generate 40-60 flashcards following schema: Mix types, balance levels/layers. Output as JSON array of card objects. Ensure distractors per protocol. Sources: edrm.net, FRCP. Voter consensus: Full stages, pedagogy, completeness.
